title: Treat Heat Stroke Emergency
brief: Provide emergency treatment for life-threatening heat stroke with immediate cooling.
steps: Step 1: Recognize symptoms: lack of sweat, hot/dry skin, headache, dizziness, fast pulse, nausea/vomiting, mental confusion leading to unconsciousness.
Step 2: IMMEDIATELY get person to shade - this is a life-threatening emergency.
Step 3: Lay patient on stretcher or elevated surface about 45 centimeters off ground.
Step 5: Pour water on patient (any water, even polluted or brackish) and fan aggressively.
Step 6: Massage arms, legs, and body to promote circulation.
Step 7: If patient regains consciousness, give small amounts of water every 3 minutes.
Step 8: Continue cooling until body temperature drops and patient stabilizes.
warnings: Heat stroke can be fatal if not treated immediately with aggressive cooling.
The patient may die if cooling is delayed - speed is critical.
Even polluted water should be used for cooling as this is a life-threatening emergency.
Continue treatment even if patient appears unconscious - they may recover.
